cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across south Florida overnight, then forecast to enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Saturday night and turn northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida coast near the Miami–Fort Lauderdale area

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, FL (includes Port Everglades)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southern Florida tonight–Saturday; later the northern Gulf Coast from the FL Panhandle westward to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Friday night through Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Atlantic side of south Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 1–3 in with isolated 5 in leading to flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized street/urban flooding; hazardous marine conditions and high surf/rip currents
